Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • World2D
      • Object2D
        • Ball

  • public class Ball
extends Object2D
    The Ball class provides an instantiable 2D object that possesses a mass, radius, color, restitution value, and velocity vector.
    Version:
    %I% %G%
    Author:
    Robert James Meade
    See Also:
    Vector

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Color color
      Color of the ball
      private double mass
      mass of the ball (proportional to radius)
      private static double massToArea
      ratio of mass to area for the ball
      private int radius
      radius of the ball (proportional to mass)
      private double restitution
      coefficient of restitution for ball's collisions with objects of very high mass
      private Vector2 velocity
      The balls's velocity as a vector referenced to the horizontal with x and y components

      • Fields inherited from class World2D

        gravityAcceleration

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calcMass()
      The calcMass method updates the ball's mass as pertinent to its radius and massToArea ratio.
      void calcRadius()
      The calcRadius method updates the ball's radius as pertinent to its mass and massToArea ratio.
      void collision(Ball b)
      The collision method manages the change in momentum and energy for the collision of two balls.
      java.awt.Color getColor()
      The getColor method gets the color of the ball.
      double getMass()
      The getMass method gets the mass of the ball.
      int getRadius()
      The getRadius method gets the radius of the ball.
      double getRestitution()
      The getRestitution method gets the value of restitution for the ball.
      Vector2 getVelocity()
      The getVelocity method gets the velocity of the ball as a deep copy of the ball's velocity vector.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
      The paint method is used by an applet to draw the object.
      void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
      The setColor method sets the color of the ball.
      void setMass(double mass)
      The setMass method sets the mass of the ball and updates its radius accordingly.
      void setRadius(int radius)
      The setRadius method sets the radius of the ball and updates the ball's mass accordingly.
      void setRestitution(double e)
      The setRestitution method sets the value of restitution for the ball.
      void setVelocity(Vector2 velocity)
      The setVelocity method sets the ball's velocity as a deep copy of the passed in vector.
      void update(double time)
      The update method is used to update the object in accordance with time.

      • calcRadius

        public void calcRadius()

      • calcMass

        public void calcMass()
        The calcMass method updates the ball's mass as pertinent to its radius and massToArea ratio.

      • collision

        public void collision(Ball b)
        The collision method manages the change in momentum and energy for the collision of two balls. Both ball's velocities are updated as a result (You do not need to call the method of each of the colliding balls, only one). The collision is considered to be perfectly elastic.
        Parameters:
        b - Ball this is colliding with

      • getRadius

        public int getRadius()
        The getRadius method gets the radius of the ball.
        Returns:
        radius of ball
